claim_text: Costa Rica has achieved 99% electricity availability while maintaining relatively low per capita carbon emissions through renewable energy sources
Norway has nearly 100% electricity availability with hydroelectric power providing about 96% of electricity generation
Norway's hydroelectric power provides about 96% of electricity generation
Iceland has 100% electricity availability with nearly 100% renewable electricity from geothermal and hydroelectric sources
Iceland generates nearly 100% renewable electricity from geothermal and hydroelectric sources
Uruguay has achieved over 95% electricity availability with 95% of electricity from renewable sources including wind, hydro, and biomass
Uruguay generates 95% of electricity from renewable sources including wind, hydro, and biomass
Albania has high electricity availability with over 95% of electricity from hydroelectric power
West Virginia has the highest COPD rate in the US
Kentucky has the second highest COPD rate in the US
Alabama has high COPD rates
Wyoming generates approximately 80% of electricity from coal
West Virginia generates approximately 90% of electricity from coal
Kentucky generates approximately 70% of electricity from coal
North Dakota generates approximately 70% of electricity from coal
Utah generates approximately 60% of electricity from coal
Adult obesity rate in the United States reached approximately 36.5%
Adult obesity rates increased from about 30% in the early 2000s to 36.5%
Childhood obesity affects approximately 19.3% of children and adolescents aged 2-19
Annual healthcare costs related to obesity exceed $200 billion
